intro: Sylphia cabellensis, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of South America. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a valuable addition to botanical collections and gardens.
